intro: Diplodiscus trichospermus, commonly known as the three-seeded burr, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant produces small, green, vine-like stems that bear yellow flowers and later develop into spiny, three-seeded burrs. Its fruit is characterized by its distinctive three-seed structure and rough, prickly surface. The plant is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
